reviews.review_msg: He's a great prof. He's completely clear on what he expects from you and based on the learning objectives in his class. Very approachable and always ready to answer questions and discuss issues related to the subject. One of the best profs I've had @ SFU. Yes the lectures r dry but thats not his fault.. learning scientific facts is not thrilling

He is a good teacher except the lectures are boring as they could get. He is very helpful always makes sure you understand the concepts well. Omits questions from the exam if a lot of people got it wrong on the exam. Exams are fair overall some questions might be tricky. Overall good prof but his lectures a re a bit dry.
Just know this: he is absolutely the GOAT of this topic and, on top of that, makes the class extremely funny. Two midterms (MCQs) and a presentation + paper make your grade.

Words cannot express how enthusiastic, passionate, and just AMAZING this guy is. His self-depreciating humor makes 3 hours of class feel like 3 minutes. He cares about all his students and works hard to learn their names and get to know them on a personal level. There's lots of readings but just come ready to learn. Absolute gem of a professor

He's cares about what he teaches and honestly if it wasn't for the TA's this class would have gone better for a lot of people. The midterms were fair if you pay attention, and do the reading you will basically be set, but in terms of the term paper finish it early so you can ask questions and attend the office hours if you want to do well.

I loved Pablo's class. Came into the semester kind of regretting it at first because a lot of the topics were new. But new isn't always bad. The way he explained topics was admirable; minimal text on the slides and with passion. only issue was the vagueness of the Term paper marking scheme. take his course if you enjoy a challenge and new ideas!

Pablo made HSCI216 enjoyable. He is knowledgeable and passionate about HSCI, integrating his own research into the lectures. There are multiple readings but he further explains the main idea in lecture for better understanding. Be sure to attend! Final grade is based on two midterms, a paper, a presentation, and tutorial participation.

Pablo is an amazing professor, you learn a lot. It's not an easy class, but it feels really rewarding and I genuinely love the topics that were covered. It helps that Pablo is basically a standup comedian, his lecture hall should have a brick wall and microphone stand dedicated for him.

Pablo is 1 of top professors I've had. The thing is, it's not an easy A class, but you're so engaged and intrigued in lectures - meaning ACTUAL learning - which means I actually enjoy lec. His funny real life anecdotes make otherwise abstract concepts stick way better. 2 midterms, 1 paper, tut participation, lec matters in understanding material
All I can say is the accents is main problem for student.

Great professor. He really cares about his students and relates many topics to himself to help to understand. Exams were extremely easy and fair, all topics covered in lecture or tutorial questions. Lectures are long but the content was learnable. This class should be more popular. Attendance is mandatory.

Hard to take during intersession but very rewarding. Pablo is educated, cares about his students, and provides countless opportunities to ask questions and succeed in his course. Midterms were fair, participation is mandatory. Overall, the course content was very interesting and makes you think of the world in a different way. Absolutely loved it.

Pablo is one of my favourite profs at sfu! His lectures are super interesting, but the course itself was too. The quizzes and presentation were pretty straight forward. The paper was a little tedious but if you follow the rubric you'll do good (got a 90, started few days before it was due lol). If you get the chance, definitely take this course!

Best. Prof. Ever. Seriously, this guy reminded me why I majored in Hsci in the 1st place. Very interesting topics covered, great OH discussions. Yes, its a lot of work (especially the paper.. I put in 40+ hours.. but also got a 95% on it. )Put in the work and effort and you'll succeed. Cannot recommend enough!! Pablo for President 2024

Pablo's lectures were always very funny and engaging. It is obvious that he is very knowledgeable and passionate about what he teaches as he integrates his own research into the lectures and readings. Although the readings were long, he went over most of them during lecture so they were easy to understand. Hope to take a class with him again!

Ideally, if this class was in person, the lectures would be 1 hour 50 mins one day and 50 mins the other day that same week, adding up to 2 hours and 40 mins. The lecture recordings posted a week are way longer than 3 hours.

Pable tried to make the online course approachable but his online teaching needs work. Lectures recorded in multiple parts and were way longer than necessary. Everything was asynchronous except a 10min quiz every week which made no sense. Prof refused to accommodate anyone.
Very funny and nice prof, he adjusted to the online mode of teaching very well. Highly recommend

clear explanations during recorded lectures, marked us on term paper, weekly quizzes and tutorial presentation/participation. multiple required readings for each lecture but I got away with a good grade without reading them. as long as you attend lectures, the quizzes are pretty easy.
Marked on quizzes, term paper, and tutorial presentation. Simple, but A LOT OF READINGS. Overall, good and passionate prof with interesting material.

Pablo is an amazing prof! You can tell he is very passionate about what he teaches, he gives good feedback and the midterms are pretty simple especially if you just show up to lecture. He's also pretty funny. Would 100% recommend.
Multiple choice questions are tricky and the majority of them are based on the lectures. Hard to keep up with him during lecture.
Very passionate about his job and explains the material in different ways to make sure we understand. would highly recommend a class with him.
Really supportive and encouraging. Participate and you will earn bonus marks!

He is an AMAZING professor, who truly cares about his students and goes the extra mile. I took his class in the summer, and even though his lectures were 3 hours long time seemed to fly. Best professor I have ever had at SFU.
one of the best profs, he really cares about his students and is very passionate about his course. The material is also very interesting. Don't miss lectures

Pablo is extremely funny at times, which makes his 3 hour lectures somewhat enjoyable. Attend his lectures as he includes the things he says in lecture on midterms since he does not have his lectures recorded. His required readings for this class are the articles he finds that relates to the topic of the lecture

solid prof, relatively interesting and organized slides/material.  tests are all multiple choice (40-45 #). need to come to class and read required reading since lec/textbook material can show up directly in test. very friendly especially during office hours rarely leaving until every1 has asked all their questions. bonus marks in lec participation
I took this class last year. It was fantastic. One of the best prof in SFU. Recommend for sure.

Lectures are way too long, tests are tricky so you really need to know your information. Also, he posts lecture slides after class is over, which can make it difficult to put together whats on his slides and what he said in class. Theres a lot of readings for this class since there is no textbook. definitely not an easy course.

Tests are extremely difficult. Sure, it's all MC but it's not on content, it's based on what HE thinks. For example, there will  be a question on a hypothesis and one of the options will explain the hypothesis, but NO, the answer is HIS opinion on what the hypothesis is. So, if you skip class, good luck passing.

Pablo makes lecture entertaining to say the least, even though they are three hours. The only complaint I have is that sometimes his lectures are a little confusing and will go in different directions so when I am going back to study I have trouble putting it all together. Other than that very funny prof who loves teaching and has lots of knowledge

He's clear and upfront of what he wants. I wouldn't say he's an amazing prof, but he's not bad either. The material is easy and you can probably learn off the powerpoints without going to class. If you have Amber for your TA then you're set
very good prof

Pablo is probably one of the best profs I have had. Even though lectures are a grueling 3 hours long, he keeps it entertaining with his way of lecturing and occasional jokes. There is a fair amount of readings required, but it pays off in the end.Definitely recommend this prof and class.
Really nice guy who is passionate about teaching this course. I would recommend!

Pablo was one of the best profs i've had at university, he always kept the course material interesting. I took this class during intersession- lots of reading and work but it pays off.  I really feel like i learned a lot from this class (didn't just memorize facts) and the prof got me really interested in human reproductive ecology. GREAT CLASS

Amazing Prof! Probably my favourite at SFU so far! He keeps his lectures interesting and engaging. As long as you attend his lectures and do the readings, it's not hard to get a good grade. His exams were extremely fair. I highly recommend this class and this prof!

He was a great teacher, encouraged everyone to participate. Very passionate about subject and it shows! Try's to keep class interesting during the dry points. He defiantly wants the kids in his class to do great! Overall he is a great prof with a sense of humor to always keep you involved and alert!
Very interactive class. He encourages participation and studying with peers. He makes all the lectures interesting and has a great attitude with the class. Pest professor I have had so far.

Great teacher who was willing to help, and always kept his office doors open for drop-in questions. He was very clear on what he demanded and pushed the class to do well. He wanted all his students to do well and made the course interactive and enjoyable.
Great class and great prof. Pablo has a lot of passion in what he teaches. This class is no gimme as there were a lot of assignments and readings.

I wish every prof could be like Pablo. This man has so much passion in what he teaches, so much enthusiam in his lectures, you can't help but develop an affinity for him. He cares about his students success, he means what he says when he wants to see the whole class get an A. He is simply fantastic and a pleasure to learn from!
Great prof! If you attend lecture (and pay attention to his analogies) some of the exam questions will be incredibly simple. Love that he encourages participation and gives out bonus marks in return.

Great Prof, really enjoyed his lectures. However the course wasn't organized well this semester. The exams were straight forward but the wording was hard to understand, so a few probs there. But interesting course, bonus marks, and fun!! Possible to get an A, just study =)

Great guy. You gotta actually be in lecture to understand the exams.  He does get a little confusing at times but you'll be given a kajillion chances to make sure you understand. Lectures were always interactive and enjoyable. Sometimes they do get rather dull from lecture videos.

Nice guy but WOW...super disorganized, very hard to follow. Way too much reading assignments in this class and the readings were all over the place. Be prepared to fail this class or get a horrible grade. Do not take this class until it has been fully put together and is organized which will probably be after a few semesters.

I really liked Pablo. He gives a great lecture, is funny and engaging, and obviously loves his work. That being said, this course was quite disorganized so if you are somebody who requires a rigid schedule you might go a bit crazy. He doesn't use the american grading system anymore so it is totally possible to get an A
